news_title: Cheapest Ways to Buy Bitcoin Online - CoinTrust
news_content: Keeping the dreaded transaction fees and often all of the additional processing fees when you wish to buy any quantity or unit of Bitcoin or for that matter any digital currencies as low as possible is critical, for if you just sign up to any exchange you could be paying way too much! With that in mind please do read through today’s news story for I will be showing you several different ways that you can keep your costs down. Obviously the digital currency exchange you choose to make use of is always going to have their own fees and charges, so always select one with the lowest fees! Getting a clear understanding of those fees and charges can however be difficult if you have never place an order to by Bitcoin or any other digital currency. So, first and foremost do keep in mind that there are always going to be movement fees when buying Bitcoin, and as such you want to select a digital currency exchange that has the lowest movement fees. Also the payment method you choose to pay for your digital currency is also an important factor, for if you use for example a credit card to buy your Bitcoin with then you may find the fees and charges associated with doing so are higher than if you use a debit card! So always take a look at the fees and costs pages that you will find displayed at all digital currency exchanges and try and select a payment method with the very lowest fees associated with them. It is not only going to be the rather fee hungry digital currency exchanges that you are going to be able to buy Bitcoin from, for there are plenty of other ways you can make a purchase of any quantity of the cryptocurrency you wish to buy. One of the ways it was of course designed for was to perform peer to peer transactions and as such if you know someone who wishes to sell Bitcoin and you want to buy some then do a transaction with those people, as you could and probably will save a small fortune in fees when you do so. https://youtu.be/A8zdpnC8L-g There is in fact a service offered by Local Bitcoin and when you make use of their site they will match you up with someone close by where you live who wants to sell Bitcoin or buy Bitcoin and as such you could use their services to find someone to do peer to peer transactions with! You may also find by doing such a transaction you can lock in and agreed price that you will have to pay for your Bitcoin, instead of having to rely on the spot rate that a digital currency exchange will offer you at the time they sell it to you! If you are lucky enough to live nearby a Bitcoin ATM then you are of course going to be able to use one of those machines tobuy Bitcoin on the spot, and I do have to say I have found them to be quite popular, and that does of course mean the number of Bitcoin ATM’s are going to constantly increase in number of people are using them! But at the end of the day a Bitcoin ATM is of course there to make money for the operator and supplier of those machines, and as such there are still going to befees and chargesthat you will have to pay when buying or even selling Bitcoin through such a machine. It has also been found that much likedigital currency exchangeswhen the price of Bitcoin does for example crashes in price and there is something of a mad panic to sell Bitcoin those machines can go offline for a certain amount of time. However, if you do wish to buy Bitcoin then you are never going to have any difficulties finding somewhere to buy them from, which cannot be said when you wish to sell Bitcoin as there have been many times when there are some very long delays in you putting in a sell order to sell Bitcoin and the amount of time a digital currency exchange will take to process those orders. news_title: Morph Launches on Ethereum, Targeting Mass Blockchain Adoption
news_content: Morph, a globally recognized platform for advancing blockchain adoption, has officially launched its mainnet on Ethereum, a significant development in its journey toward creating a blockchain experience that is accessible to mainstream users. The launch of the Morph mainnet introduces a consumer layer designed to overcome common adoption barriers by enabling participants to trade real assets and engage in various blockchain transactions. With the mainnet now live, projects already developed on Morph can seamlessly transition to this broader ecosystem, potentially increasing user engagement and accelerating the platform’s consumer-focused growth. CEO and co-founder Cecilia Hsueh emphasized that this mainnet launch is a major achievement in Morph’s goal to bring blockchain technology to a broad audience. She indicated that most decentralized applications (DApps) are currently inaccessible to everyday users and stated that Morph’s objective is to bridge this gap by providing a decentralized, scalable, and secure infrastructure. This will enable developers to create the next generation of user-friendly DApps and offer non-crypto natives the opportunity to interact easily within the blockchain ecosystem. Morph’s consumer layer is a comprehensive environment combining advanced blockchain technologies, such as optimistic and zero-knowledge (ZK) rollups, which improve both security and scalability. The solution is crafted to address longstanding issues in blockchain, including regulatory restrictions, scalability limitations, and performance challenges. With these improvements, Morph is striving to make blockchain accessible to a wider user base by offering builders an experience that prioritizes scalability, security, and simplicity. Morph’s mainnet debut builds on the successes of its earlier Holesky testnet, which featured several key upgrades that have been integrated into the mainnet. One notable advancement was the EIP-4844 Optimistic zkVM integration, a feature that reduces transaction costs and offers an updated bridge mechanism allowing for single-transaction withdrawals. During the testnet phase, Morph recorded substantial engagement, with over six million wallet addresses, more than 100 million transactions, 200 projects deployed, and over one million community members. This high level of activity highlights the network’s appeal to developers and users alike and lays a strong foundation for further adoption on the mainnet. COO and co-founder Azeem Khan highlighted that Morph’s goal is to be a comprehensive resource for global builders, providing them with tools to help them achieve success in launching and scaling their blockchain projects. He pointed out that while decentralization is critical, builders face challenges in finding the resources needed for successful project development, launch, and expansion. Morph aims to address this gap by creating an environment tailored to the needs of builders, thereby facilitating a more accessible path to blockchain success. Morph distinguishes itself from other blockchain platforms by prioritizing a consumer-focused approach rather than remaining limited to purely technical features. This consumer layer strategy involves offering critical resources to builders, including funding, incubation, acceleration, and market strategies, all aimed at fostering a user-first approach to blockchain development. Among its initiatives, Morph recently launched the Centralized Exchange Coalition, which includes several leading centralized exchanges, to empower builders with the tools necessary to bring projects to market, attract new users, and secure essential funding. Through these supportive measures, Morph seeks to position itself as a significant driver of blockchain innovation and adoption, facilitating a new wave of user-friendly applications that can appeal to a broad audience. This support system aligns with Morph’s overarching vision of transforming the blockchain industry from a niche technological space to an accessible mainstream utility. By equipping builders with the necessary resources, Morph aims to generate a broad ecosystem of applications that meet diverse user needs and contribute to increased blockchain adoption. Morph operates as a global consumer layer, serving as a distribution hub that provides builders with the resources needed to launch and scale their projects for the mass market. Through the use of hybrid rollup technology, combining ZK and Optimistic rollups, and employing a decentralized sequencer, Morph opens up limitless possibilities for developers targeting a mainstream audience. This unique blend of technology allows Morph to offer a user-friendly experience for developers who seek to create accessible and secure blockchain applications. As one of Morph’s original investors, Bitget, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, will continue to play a role in supporting the Morph ecosystem and contributing to its growth. With these strategic partnerships and innovative technologies, Morph is positioned to make a significant impact on the blockchain industry by paving the way for consumer-friendly, scalable applications that cater to everyday users. By emphasizing accessibility, resource support, and advanced technology, Morph aims to transform the blockchain landscape and drive a new era of blockchain adoption for all. news_title: Instruxi Launches Mesh ID to Simplify Secure Access to Tokenized Assets
news_content: Instruxi, an emerging decentralized data management platform, has introduced Mesh ID, its latest Web3 solution aimed at revolutionizing access to tokenized Real-World Assets (RWAs) for over 22 million U.S. residents. This innovative tool is designed to simplify identity verification processes, enhance data privacy, and improve user accessibility to blockchain-based financial products in a way that aligns with regulatory requirements. Instruxi has collaborated with prominent industry players, including Chainlink, CLEAR, and Space and Time, to launch the Mesh ID solution as the initial module of its RWA platform. This collaboration, announced via a recent press release, leverages each partner’s strengths to optimize identity verification and provide robust data security for blockchain applications. Mesh ID integrates with CLEAR’s advanced API, enabling streamlined know-your-customer (KYC) processing without compromising user privacy or security. With CLEAR’s established track record of serving over 25 million users, Instruxi’s solution stands to benefit from a reputable, tier-one identity verification system. The Instruxi-CLEAR partnership facilitates faster pre-approval and minimizes KYC processing times, ultimately making on-chain financial products more accessible to U.S.-based users while ensuring regulatory compliance. In addition to CLEAR, Chainlink brings substantial value to Instruxi’s platform. As a leading decentralized computing platform, Chainlink supports Mesh ID’s seamless integration with enterprise systems, offering both on-chain and off-chain security assurances. Chainlink’s extensive suite of Oracle services has been pivotal in enabling secure data interactions, a key factor in asset tokenization’s projected $867 trillion market potential. Instruxi employs Chainlink Functions to enable access to real-world data via APIs and utilizes Chainlink Automation to ensure efficient, scalable operations within a decentralized framework. Further strengthening Mesh ID’s infrastructure, Instruxi has collaborated with Space and Time, a decentralized data warehouse for blockchain applications. Space and Time’s zero-knowledge database enables users to verify elements of their data and identity without exposing sensitive details on-chain. This feature enhances security while facilitating privacy-conscious access to RWAs, aligning with Instruxi’s mission to uphold data confidentiality as a cornerstone of its offerings. Austin Przybysz, Instruxi’s Co-Founder and Solutions Architect, highlighted the importance of the Mesh ID beta release, noting that this collaboration integrates KYC and identity verification within Instruxi Data Mesh to enable universal policy enforcement capabilities across the platform. He underscored the significance of combining high standards of user security with regulatory compliance to broaden accessibility to tokenized assets in a seamless, compliant manner. With the launch of Mesh ID, Instruxi is positioning itself at the forefront of asset tokenization, starting with tokenized real estate assets for its closed beta users. As the platform moves toward its full release, the company plans to expand its asset offerings to include additional classes, aligning with its goal to make a broad range of tokenized RWAs available through a user-centric, decentralized platform. Real-World Assets, or RWAs, refer to digital tokens that represent traditional financial assets, including cash, securities, commodities, and real estate, on the blockchain. By converting these assets into blockchain-based tokens, users gain new benefits such as fractional ownership, programmability, enhanced liquidity, transparency, and improved risk management. This emerging sector is gaining traction, with projections estimating a valuation of $10 trillion by 2030. Instruxi’s Mesh ID release signals a step toward a future where blockchain technology provides enhanced access to real-world financial assets in a way that preserves data privacy, streamlines verification processes, and ensures regulatory compliance. Through collaborations with industry leaders like Chainlink, CLEAR, and Space and Time, Instruxi demonstrates a commitment to creating an ecosystem where decentralized finance and real-world assets can coexist securely and efficiently. With Mesh ID’s launch, the platform takes a crucial step toward transforming how users interact with and access tokenized assets, setting a promising course for the future of Web3 applications in asset management. news_title: Ethereum Wallets Surge in Popularity as Plus Wallet Redefines User Experience
news_content: Ethereum has been witnessing unprecedented growth, with wallets now collectively holding over 19 million ETH. Projections suggest this number could exceed 20 million by year’s end, marking a significant milestone that reflects a rising interest in cryptocurrency among prominent economic players. This surge in Ethereum holdings underscores the increasing role of digital assets in mainstream financial markets and has drawn attention to the critical role of secure, feature-rich wallets. Throughout 2024, Ethereum wallet usage has experienced substantial growth, with the total amount of ETH held rising from 11.5 million at the beginning of the year to over 19 million by mid-October. Valued at approximately $2,700 per ETH, these holdings are currently worth close to $80 billion, a figure comparable to the market capitalizations of some leading global corporations. Industry observers attribute part of this growth to the recent approval of Ethereum spot ETFs, which has boosted investor confidence and helped cement Ethereum’s place as a key financial asset. As the value and prevalence of digital assets grow, so does the demand for wallets that provide more than just storage. Emerging platforms like Plus Wallet are responding by offering a suite of functionalities designed to enhance user engagement and satisfaction. In addition to multi-chain accessibility, Plus Wallet provides robust security features and dual rewards programs, making it a popular choice for those navigating the expanding cryptocurrency landscape. Amid the increased focus on Ethereum, another notable development comes from Ctrl Wallet, which is enhancing its operational framework by migrating its $XDEFI token to $CTRL. This transition aims to improve token liquidity and optimize the wallet’s token structure for a more seamless user experience. Holders of $XDEFI and $vXDEFI on Ethereum and Arbitrum are encouraged to exchange their tokens for $CTRL at a one-to-one ratio through a dedicated migration portal, with fees waived until the end of 2024. Leading exchanges, including KuCoin and Huobi, are supporting this transition, and 32% of the total $CTRL token supply will be secured in liquidity pools for the next twelve months. news_title: Deadfellaz and Skale Labs Partner for Gas-Free NFT Trading Card Game Launch
news_content: In a strategic step towards mainstream adoption of blockchain gaming, Skale Labs has collaborated with DFZ Labs, the creative force behind the successful Deadfellaz NFT collection, to introduce an innovative trading card game (TCG) called Death Touch. Expected to launch in the first quarter of 2025, this new game will be accessible on mobile devices, positioning it to attract a broad range of users and serve as an entry point for a more mainstream audience into blockchain gaming. The Deadfellaz NFT collection originally debuted on Ethereum in August 2021, crafted by co-founders Psych and Betty, and quickly gained traction due to its unique themes and early endorsement by high-profile figures, including Reese Witherspoon, Steve Aoki, Bill Murray, and Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian. The collection’s rise in popularity underscored the appeal of digital collectibles with strong community elements, which the founders are now extending into a mobile trading card game format. Skale Labs, known for its scalable, gas-free blockchain solutions, currently supports a network of over 150 games in various development stages within its ecosystem. The recent partnership with DFZ Labs builds upon this base by leveraging Skale’s infrastructure to optimize Death Touch for accessibility and performance. As a gas-free Ethereum scaling solution, Skale’s blockchain facilitates more user-friendly experiences, which are crucial for attracting casual and competitive gamers alike. This partnership also reflects Skale’s broader strategic objectives, following a recent collaboration with gaming pioneer Nolan Bushnell—founder of Atari—whose gaming tournament platform, Moxy, is set to integrate with Skale’s infrastructure. According to Andrew Saunders, Chief Marketing and Growth Officer at Skale Labs, integrating the Deadfellaz franchise within the Skale ecosystem aligns with Skale’s mission to prioritize consumer-friendly applications of blockchain. He expressed his enthusiasm for seeing blockchain gaming projects like Deadfellaz actively working toward broader consumer adoption. Saunders highlighted the growth potential in a gaming landscape that he sees as evolving toward greater consumer focus rather than being purely brand-driven. He further noted that having followed Deadfellaz closely since its inception, he felt optimistic about their expansion into new gaming genres.  The Horde rises from the shadows…gas-free! 🧟♀️@Deadfellazis conjuring their TCG game, Death Touch, on SKALE, summoning a seamless, gas-free gaming experience from the underworld. 🎮 Learn more about the upcoming launch:https://t.co/ut1Hn2WuMepic.twitter.com/JjmLPgZzcp — SKALE (@SkaleNetwork)October 29, 2024  Psych, co-founder of Deadfellaz, outlined the team’s ambitions for Death Touch as an evolution of the interactive and gamified storytelling that has characterized Deadfellaz’s journey so far. By building a mobile-first title that embraces the trading card game genre, DFZ Labs aims to offer a more dynamic and engaging experience for fans seeking fresh interactions within the TCG space. He emphasized that partnering with Skale would enable Death Touch to grow as a free-to-play title, providing a seamless experience for both Web3 gamers and traditional gamers. The gas-free structure of Skale’s blockchain, he noted, allows them to reach a wider demographic, including competitive players and casual users who may be new to blockchain-based games. The collaboration between Skale Labs and DFZ Labs is set against a larger trend of integrating blockchain technology within the gaming industry. With projects like Death Touch, these partnerships are moving closer to offering scalable, user-friendly platforms for gaming experiences that combine digital collectibles with gameplay. By addressing key pain points such as transaction fees, Skale’s gas-free blockchain approach makes it easier for developers to target a mainstream audience, potentially bridging the gap between blockchain gaming enthusiasts and traditional gaming communities. Through the creation of this new TCG, Skale Labs and DFZ Labs are not only building upon the Deadfellaz brand but are also aiming to redefine user interaction within Web3 applications. This partnership signals a step towards making blockchain gaming more accessible and engaging, ensuring players experience the benefits of blockchain without the common obstacles associated with it. With the anticipated launch of Death Touch, Skale Labs and DFZ Labs appear poised to bring blockchain gaming to an even broader market, pushing the boundaries of interactive digital experiences and setting a new precedent for community-driven gaming in the Web3 space. news_title: Ubisoft Quietly Launches Blockchain Game Champions Tactics
news_content: Ubisoft, a prominent player in the gaming industry, has officially entered the blockchain arena with the release of its first blockchain-based game, Champions Tactics: Grimoria Chronicles. This new title introduces a tactical, turn-based experience incorporating NFTs (non-fungible tokens) as key in-game assets. Initially announced by the company in June, Champions Tactics represents a significant development following Ubisoft’s ongoing blockchain experimentation, yet the release itself was relatively low-profile. Available for PC, the game is free to start, though players have the option to purchase NFT figurines—digital assets with unique attributes—using either in-game currency or cryptocurrency on an integrated marketplace. The game showcases Ubisoft’s approach to combining collectible digital items with innovative gameplay. The gameplay model in Champions Tactics focuses on turn-based battles where players face off using teams of three figurines, each with distinct characteristics. While it’s possible to participate in the game without purchasing any of these NFTs, the option is available to those willing to invest in them, with prices for these unique figurines varying widely on the marketplace from $7 to as high as $64,000. These collectible NFTs provide a significant advantage in gameplay, allowing for deeper engagement and competition among players. Ubisoft’s Strategic Innovation Lab collaborated with Oasys to design Champions Tactics with a focus on integrating blockchain in a way that enhances the gaming experience. According to Ubisoft’s Paris studio director, François Bodson, the game introduces innovative features that mirror traditional trading card games but with unique digital assets under player control. The blockchain foundation, he added, was used to create “new and innovative” gaming experiences, providing players with enhanced agency and ownership over their assets. Each NFT figurine, procedurally generated and unique in its attributes, provides strategic depth and flexibility as players can shape their assets and teams through player-driven choices. The design includes an open marketplace for players to build squads using a peer-to-peer model. During the game’s development, Ubisoft actively sought community feedback through events and beta phases, ensuring that player insights contributed to the evolution of Champions Tactics. Ubisoft intends to continue refining and expanding the game based on community engagement, as the game’s blockchain-enabled infrastructure allows for adaptability and growth. While the Adult Only rating for the game wasn’t addressed directly by Ubisoft, it is likely tied to the game’s use of blockchain elements and cryptocurrency-based transactions. In addition to its blockchain debut, Ubisoft previously ventured into the NFT space with Quartz, a dedicated NFT platform launched in December 2021. Initially, this project involved NFT offerings for Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon Breakpoint, but it encountered limited success, with only a small number of NFTs sold. Despite these early challenges, Ubisoft executives maintained that the potential for player-driven value in blockchain assets held promise, even though initial reception was lukewarm. Ubisoft’s dedication to blockchain persisted despite these setbacks and contrasts with the more cautious or skeptical stance other industry players have adopted toward cryptocurrency in gaming. Within the broader gaming landscape, there has been a noticeable shift in blockchain enthusiasm. Even Electronic Arts (EA), which once expressed interest in NFTs as an essential part of gaming’s future, has since stepped back, adopting a wait-and-see approach. EA’s CEO Andrew Wilson had previously highlighted the enduring appeal of collectible items in gaming, though he emphasized that NFT integration was not an immediate focus for the company. He suggested that NFT integration would only be explored further if it aligned with EA’s core mission of enhancing player experiences. Ubisoft’s release of Champions Tactics: Grimoria Chronicles therefore stands out in the industry, as other major companies scale back on blockchain plans amid uncertain player reception. In choosing to launch Champions Tactics, Ubisoft reinforces its commitment to blockchain exploration, placing a long-term bet on digital collectibles and player-controlled assets as part of its strategy. With this title, Ubisoft aims to carve a space in the emerging field of blockchain gaming, leveraging NFTs to create unique gameplay opportunities and a player-driven economy. Whether this approach will resonate with the broader gaming community remains to be seen, but Champions Tactics marks a notable moment in Ubisoft’s digital innovation journey. news_title: G6 Networks Introduces Dual Blockchain Solution for Public and Private Sectors
news_content: G6 Networks has unveiled a dual blockchain framework designed to serve both general users and businesses, offering an adaptable solution that merges the benefits of public and private blockchain ecosystems. This approach involves two distinct components: a public chain for individual users, focusing on decentralization and digital identity, and a private chain intended for organizations with high-security needs, such as those in finance, government, and public services. The recently launched G6 Networks website provides a comprehensive look at the company’s capabilities and future objectives, highlighting upcoming developments such as the Token Fair Launch. This will be followed by the mainnet launch and Token Generation Event (TGE) slated for mid-January, bringing to life various features like decentralized storage, staking, games, and even feeless transactions. This progressive roadmap is part of G6 Networks’ commitment to empowering both individual users and enterprises with tailored blockchain applications that support secure, scalable, and flexible solutions. In an effort to enhance the efficiency and security of enterprise solutions, G6 Networks’ hybrid infrastructure integrates both public and private blockchains. While the public chain is geared toward everyday users with a focus on accessibility and digital identity, the private chain has been designed to meet the specific needs of institutions requiring a permissioned and customizable platform. This structure is ideal for enterprises where data security and scalability are paramount. Examples of sectors benefiting from this private blockchain ecosystem include financial services, government operations, and public sector entities. Additionally, G6 Networks has incorporated an advanced security layer into this infrastructure, which includes a distributed hardware storage system that ensures data resilience and maintains information integrity. One of the standout features of G6 Networks’ architecture is interoperability, a capability that facilitates interaction between different private chains—a rare functionality in blockchain platforms. This interoperability is expected to be especially valuable in fields with strict privacy requirements, such as finance and government. For instance, industries that need secure, inter-departmental communication can leverage this flexible connection feature without compromising sensitive data. To further enhance security, G6 Networks plans to introduce a zero-knowledge proof feature and encrypted data management tools. These additions will ensure that only authorized individuals can access sensitive information, protecting data privacy while maintaining transparency. In both private and public sector applications, G6 Networks aims to address critical needs ranging from digital identity management to financial transparency and secure document storage. G6 Networks co-founders Six and Gabo, who have been long-time ambassadors for Polkadot, shared that the company’s mission revolves around simplifying blockchain technology and making it more accessible to a broader audience. They emphasized that G6 Networks allows businesses and institutions to adopt scalable and efficient blockchain solutions tailored to meet their unique needs. This mission reflects the broader vision of G6 Networks to foster innovation and support sustainable growth in blockchain technology. G6 Networks’ approach to implementation follows a structured, five-phase process, beginning with a needs assessment and extending to long-term maintenance. This strategy ensures that each deployment can adapt to evolving organizational requirements, underscoring the company’s dedication to providing flexible and impactful solutions. Key upcoming milestones, such as the January mainnet launch, are anticipated to significantly expand the functionality available to users, offering tools and features designed to have real-world impact across diverse applications. By combining the security and customizability of private chains with the accessibility and interoperability of public blockchain technologies, G6 Networks aims to deliver a solution that meets a wide range of user requirements. This hybrid model, enriched by future features like feeless transactions, decentralized storage, and encrypted data management, stands out in the current blockchain landscape. With a vision rooted in long-term utility and innovation, G6 Networks is positioned to lead in the development of adaptable blockchain solutions that cater to the unique needs of both individual users and large institutions. news_title: Square’s Patent For Crypto Payment Network Approved
news_content: Square, a leading digital payment company recently announced that it has hit another milestone. Papers recentlypublished by the US Patent & Trademark Office(USPTO) reveal that the office has formally approved of the company’s patent application for a crypto payment system. This will allow merchants to accept cryptocurrency payments from anywhere. Square filed for this patent in September 2017 and it has been close to a year for them to get the required approval. The new patent is not as revolutionary as it seems. Other payment processors likeBitPayhave allowed automatic conversion of cryptocurrencies into local currency before. The main difference is the high level of market penetration that Square has across the globe. Square is a market leaderwhen it comes to point-of-sale (POS) payments and adding cryptocurrency payments to that would be a big advantage. Merchants who already use Square would appreciate the added functionality and it would open a whole new market for cryptocurrencies. The biggest breakthrough that the patent gives to the network is its elimination of latency when it comes to bitcoin transactions. This allows for fasterbitcoin transactions– which is the main barrier to a lot of bitcoin payments. Square does this maintaining its own blockchain network that keeps a record of transactions that are then sent to the public blockchain. This transfers the risk of double spend attacks from the merchant to Square, encouraging merchants to take the risks. Another method by which transaction latency is eliminated is by having user funds held by Square, with Square updating its internal ledgers instead of referring to the external blockchain. However, a patent approval does not mean that Square will be implementing the system any time soon. Other companies have applied for crypto payment patents and have done nothing with them. For example,Bank of Americahas a number of them but the bank does not seem to be planning to use any of them. Square could be different in this regard because CEOJack Dorseyis a big fan of cryptocurrencies and he may want to push for a quick implementation. In a statement, Dorsey said The internet deserves a native currency. It will have a native currency. I don’t know if it will be Bitcoin or not. I hope it will be bitcoin Dorsey also says that Square’s interest in Bitcoin goes beyond just buying and selling it. The Square Cash app already features bitcoin trading, adding a cryptocurrency payment system to the app is a good move if Square really wants to promote bitcoin usage. news_title: Japan's FSA Responds To Reports of Crypto Current Law Changes
news_content: TheFinancial Services Agency(FSA) is Japan's highest authority when it comes to financial regulation. They are in charge of everything from stocks to cryptocurrencies. This is why the FSA has come under fire recently for being lax when it comes to regulating thecryptocurrency industryin the country. The FSA has noted that criticism hurled at them and is reportedly making changes in regulation to address the cryptocurrency industry. Currently, cryptocurrencies are managed under the revised fund settlement law. The FSA has plans to change this according to reports and will look to move it under theFinancial Instruments and Exchange Act(FIEA). This currently places cryptocurrencies as means of settlement since it is considered similar to electronic money. However, if the FSA does shift to it to the FIEA, it will no longer be considered a financial product similar to stocks and bonds. This shift can make it more complicated for cryptocurrency exchanges. Under the FIEA, companies are supposed to separate company funds from customer funds and to implement stricter protection systems to ensure that everything is legal and above board. However, these reports on the changes seem to be premature. After contacting the FSA, the agency commented that there were no plans for such changes. In a statement, the FSA said If there are such considerations, it will be taken up as an agenda for the study group the said agenda has not been discussed at all in the past 4 meetings…Things that are not on the agenda at all cannot be considered The FSA refers to the regular research meeting with experts in the crypto industry, wherein important issues are brought up and discussed. However, there is still a legitimate need for a stricter cryptocurrency law. The current revised fund settlement law is what allows cryptocurrency businesses to operate in Japan, with16 exchanges registered with the FSA. But with the recent Coincheck hack, scrutiny has increased over the cryptocurrency industry and its operators. An example of this would be the recent business improvement orders sent toTech BureauandGMO Cointo improve their internal systems for better protection. This was quickly followed by an additional sixbusiness improvement ordersto licensed exchanges. This includedBitflyer, which is currently Japan's largest bitcoin exchange. Incidents like these are part of the reason why the FSA has been criticized for its approval process on licensing crypto exchanges. Many hope that stricter laws would help improve security and safety in these licensed crypto exchanges and provide better protection to Japanese investors. news_title: France’s ‘Mister Bitcoin’ Says Crypto Providers Should Be Regulated
news_content: At present,there exist over 1,500 individual cryptocurrencies, and the number continues to increase by the week. This is because the knowledge of creating one’s own cryptocurrency has become so widespread that anyone with sufficient know-how can do it. This overabundance of cryptocurrency, of course, means that the vast majority of them will end up worthless – or at least, not as relevant as the leading cryptocurrencies. That leaves us with the question: what’s to become of these major cryptocurrencies, and of the medium as a whole?Jean-Pierre Landau, Deputy Governor of the Banque de France from 2006 to 2011, stated in a report to the French Ministry of Finance and Economy that the future of cryptocurrency would likely boil down into one of two outcomes: either it would degenerate and become marginalized, or worse, become extinct entirely; or experience what he calls a ‘Darwinian natural selection’ that would decide which of the major players in cryptocurrency attains dominance. In 2014, Landau made a critical comment about cryptocurrency, telling theFinancial Timesthat it was the21st century equivalent of the tulip(which was once used as a currency due to its phenomenally high price) and advised the people of Europe and the world at large to be wary of it. In January 2018, however, the Ministry of Finance and Economy had appointed Landau to look into the matter further and asked him to come up with his own regulations on the medium. Since this appointment, Landau had changed his tone about the issue saying that direct regulation would hamper the proactive development of an ‘evolving technology’ and that public policies should be built around avoiding that. Now known as ‘Mister Bitcoin‘, Landau goes on to say that policies should produce a conducive environment for the growth of cryptocurrency. ifo Institut InLandau’s reportto the Ministry of Finance and Economy, he said that the rarity of cryptocurrency transactions, the most common beingBitcoin accounted for only 0.2% of all transactions in Europe. This was caused by the decentralization of the medium which requires an inefficient and expensive verification method to be carried out. This creates a potentially permanent disadvantage for the cryptocurrency as according Landau states that it is impossible to marry decentralization and efficiency within the context of a monetary medium. Landau advises that regulations should not be set in stone at this point in time as the cryptocurrency process is still evolving and yet to be fully identified. Regulation, in his view, should be fully reserved for the parties making use of the product and not the product itself. news_title: Celsius Partners With Lightyear To Support ICOs on Stellar Network
news_content: Crypto lending and borrowing solution provider Celsius Networkhas joined hands with Lightyear.ioto become a leading lender and borrowing partner for ICOs conducted on the Stellar (XLM) network. Lightyear.io facilitates financial enterprises to join the Stellar ecosystem easily. Promising projects, which areplanned to be deployed on Stellar,are funded through the incubator program. Ultimately this expands Stellar ecosystem, while making it easy for project owners to raise capital. Commenting on the partnership, Celsius Network CEO, Alex Mashinskysaid “Stellar Development Foundation’s goals and our own are perfectly aligned. We’re both looking to bring in a new era of blockchain banking to both the developed and developing world and we’re excited to empower the next wave of crypto startups.” Lumens (XLM) and other tokens deployed on the Stellar network will be soon added to Android and iOS apps of Celsius. By the end of this year, Celsius hopes to enable its app users to generate interest on deposits in the form of Stellar-based tokens. Bitcoin IRA, the largest cryptocurrency individual retirement account (IRA) in the world, now boasts Stellar Lumens as the third most popular cryptocurrency. The platform allows investors to buy Bitcoin and other altcoins, including Ethereum, Litecoin, Ethereum Classic, Ripple, and Bitcoin Cash, for retirement accounts.Stellar, which was listed only in June2018, has quickly climbed up to become the third most favored crypto among users. Chris Kline, Bitcoin IRA chief operating officer,stated “We just launched Stellar Lumens and Zcash this past June, and it’s exciting to see both coins take off so quickly. With so much momentum in the crypto sector in recent months, I feel confident that the bull market is here to stay.” Stellar Lumens went through a big price correction in the past 24 hours. news_title: Thailand SEC Issues Regulations For Crypto Exchanges & ICOs
news_content: The Securities and Exchange Commission of Thailand has provided the guidelines for trading cryptocurrencies. All cryptocurrency exchanges and related business must adhere to the rules stipulated by the regulator by the end of June. The rules framed by the monitoring agency are intended to govern both trading and investments in cryptocurrencies in Thailand. Furthermore, all businesses which handle cryptocurrencies in some form or the other must apply for a new license from the regulator. The SEC, Thailand permits the official trading of ICOs. However, the tokens are allowed to be exchanged only for seven cryptocurrencies. They areBitcoin (BTC), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), XRP (Ripple), Ethereum (ETH), Stellar (XLM), and Litecoin (LTC).The seven currencies were chosen based on consensus credibility and liquidity. The SEC believes that 5-10 exchanges will apply for a license in the forthcoming weeks. Either dealers or brokerage firms which are actively involved in cryptocurrency business is expected to apply for a license. Despite the relaxations, Thai regulator is determined to preserve the safeguard its domestic currency. The regulator has clearly ruled out the possibility of trading cryptos against fiat currencies in the country. The last date to apply for a license is August 14, which represents a 90 day deadline from the date of announcement by the SEC. A sum of 5 million Baht (~$157,000) is required as an upfront fee and only companies which are registered in Thailand are allowed to apply. All licensed cryptocurrency exchanges must pay an annual fee of 0.002% on the total trading volume. Brokerage firms must pay an annual fee of 0.001% on the annual trading volume. A minimum fee of 500,000 Baht and 250,000 Baht must be paid by a cryptocurrency exchange and brokerage firm, respectively. The maximum fee is limited to 20 million Baht and 5 million Baht. As far as ICOs are concerned the SEC has stated that each ICO should clearly mention the type of tokens being issued, along with complete investment information. There is no ceiling on the number of tokens which can be granted to institutional and ultra-high net worth investors. However, for an individual investor, an investment cap of 300,000 Baht is applicable and it should not constitute more than 70% of the total value of offered tokens. The guidelines may become the reference source to regulators in other countries. news_title: FlexiNetAI Pioneers Blockchain Adoption with AI Integration Across Industries
news_content: FlexiNetAI is reshaping how industries adopt blockchain by integrating artificial intelligence (AI) within a versatile platform designed to serve sectors ranging from education and finance to healthcare, energy, and government. By combining blockchain’s transparency with AI’s analytical power, FlexiNetAI aims to streamline operations, improve decision-making, and secure data across various applications. The platform’s adaptability and emphasis on real-world applications position it as a valuable tool for modernizing systems and enabling blockchain’s adoption beyond the tech realm. In the education sector, FlexiNetAI offers solutions that make academic record-keeping more secure and transparent. By storing academic data—such as grades, certifications, and degrees—on blockchain, the platform ensures that records are tamper-proof and easily accessible to educational institutions and employers worldwide. Through AI-enhanced analytics, FlexiNetAI can identify patterns in students’ learning and offer personalized educational recommendations, allowing teachers to adjust their methods for optimal student engagement. Additionally, administrative tasks such as tuition payments and scholarship management are simplified with smart contracts, reducing the operational load on institutions. FlexiNetAI is making strides in the finance industry by enabling more efficient payment processing, asset management, and risk assessment. AI-driven analytics allow financial institutions to evaluate risk more precisely and generate tailored investment advice. Meanwhile, blockchain’s transparency and smart contract automation simplify complex transactions, reducing the need for manual processes and enhancing accuracy. By using FlexiNetAI’s platform, financial institutions can lower costs, increase transaction speeds, and improve data security, accelerating their transition toward digital, blockchain-enabled finance. The healthcare sector stands to benefit significantly from FlexiNetAI’s blockchain-based platform, which facilitates secure sharing of patient data across medical providers. The platform allows patient information to be stored and accessed without compromising privacy, enabling seamless sharing between institutions. FlexiNetAI’s AI tools analyze medical data to support accurate diagnoses and customized treatment plans, offering enhanced precision in patient care. Additionally, automated smart contracts streamline essential processes such as insurance claims and prescription management, helping healthcare providers focus on patient care while reducing administrative costs. In the energy industry, FlexiNetAI optimizes resource management and market efficiency through predictive AI algorithms and blockchain-backed smart contracts. By forecasting energy demand, the platform enables suppliers to allocate resources effectively and adjust to market shifts proactively. Smart contracts automate energy trade and transaction processes, improving transparency, reducing delays, and ultimately cutting costs. These advances support energy providers in boosting sustainability and maintaining clearer, more efficient market operations. FlexiNetAI’s platform also brings considerable advancements to supply chain management, enabling comprehensive tracking of products from raw material acquisition to final delivery. By recording every stage of the supply chain on blockchain, the platform ensures that records are both transparent and secure, helping companies mitigate fraud, errors, and inefficiencies. For government operations, FlexiNetAI provides a secure platform for managing public records, including land ownership and identity verification. Smart contracts simplify voting, benefit distribution, and other administrative tasks, while AI-driven data analysis aids in making informed decisions and optimizing public services. As FlexiNetAI expands its range of applications across industries, its platform continues to attract diverse users, fostering a collaborative ecosystem. With an open and scalable architecture, the platform invites developers and businesses to create customized blockchain applications that fit their specific needs. Partnering with industry leaders, FlexiNetAI ensures that its technology remains relevant and adapts to changing market demands, driving technological growth and encouraging blockchain adoption in mainstream applications. Looking forward, FlexiNetAI’s expanding ecosystem signifies its influence on global industry adoption of blockchain and AI. By equipping various sectors with tools for efficiency, security, and transparency, FlexiNetAI solidifies its role in advancing blockchain technology and supporting a global shift toward a digital economy. Its commitment to collaboration, real-world applications, and continuous innovation positions FlexiNetAI as a pivotal contributor to a more connected and transparent future across education, finance, healthcare, energy, and government. news_title: Chainlink Unveils CRE: Boosting Blockchain Scalability and Customization
news_content: Chainlink has introduced a transformative upgrade called the Chainlink Runtime Environment (CRE), a new platform designed to scale operations across thousands of blockchain networks while providing developers with flexible and customizable workflows. The update, shared through Chainlink’s official X account, represents a step forward in modular blockchain design by breaking down essential oracle functions into adaptable components, allowing developers to create more specialized workflows suited to individual application requirements. The CRE offers a modular and composable architecture that enables developers to tap into Chainlink’s capabilities in unique ways. By separating the fundamental functions of an oracle network—such as blockchain reading and API calling—into distinct modules, Chainlink allows developers to integrate these functions based on their specific project needs. This architecture forms the foundation of Chainlink’s ecosystem, centralizing its capabilities in a way that allows for innovative workflows triggered by decentralized oracle networks (DONs) to securely facilitate interactions across various blockchain environments. An especially appealing aspect of CRE is its support for self-serve product development. Through this upgrade, developers can design applications and processes on the platform without needing to embed specialized Chainlink code into core blockchain computations. This makes cross-blockchain communication and transactions easier for developers to implement and enhances the platform’s usability, particularly for teams seeking a more seamless way to manage cross-chain data flows and interactions. In addition to fostering more customized development, CRE’s architecture accommodates programmatic workflows, which can be adjusted for specific blockchain applications. The platform also supports standard programming languages and tools, along with standardized cross-chain components, making it more accessible for a broader audience of developers. This cross-chain functionality opens new avenues for applications that benefit from diverse blockchain networks while maintaining ease of interaction.  Introducing Chainlink Runtime Environment (CRE)—a major platform upgrade: 🔌 New modular, composable architecture⛓️ Scalable across 1000s of chains🏦 Deep customization for capital markets users🏗️ Self-serve product development 🧵⬇️https://t.co/BE807PgfB2 — Chainlink (@chainlink)October 30, 2024  To protect the user experience, Chainlink has structured the CRE upgrade as a phased rollout. This staggered approach will help the platform maintain continuity for current users throughout the transition. In the initial phase, Chainlink will focus on migrating key services such as the Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol (CCIP) to the CRE foundation. This move is expected to strengthen Chainlink’s cross-chain infrastructure, allowing for more seamless scalability as additional blockchains are integrated. As part of this upgrade, Chainlink has also introduced new blockchain integrations, including support for the Aptos blockchain. This enhanced architecture allows financial institutions to connect their existing systems with blockchain-based workflows, such as Delivery vs. Payment (DvP). By joining the early access program for CRE, users interested in exploring workflow creation on this platform can contribute to Chainlink’s growing network of cross-chain applications. The CRE upgrade thus not only benefits current users but also extends Chainlink’s reach into sectors looking for advanced interoperability solutions. Chainlink’s introduction of CRE is a significant leap forward for both the platform and its users. By providing a flexible, modular environment that facilitates blockchain interactions across various networks, CRE underscores Chainlink’s commitment to scalability and innovation within the blockchain space. This update, with its emphasis on modular design and cross-chain capabilities, positions Chainlink as a leading solution for developers seeking interoperability without compromising on customization or security. Ultimately, the Chainlink Runtime Environment stands as a promising development in blockchain technology, allowing developers to build applications that cater to diverse, decentralized workflows while simplifying the complexities of cross-chain data exchange. Through CRE, Chainlink continues to evolve as a platform that enables not only decentralized finance but also a broader ecosystem of blockchain-powered applications tailored to specific business and industry requirements. news_title: Instruxi Launches Mesh ID to Simplify Secure Access to Tokenized Assets
news_content: Instruxi, an emerging decentralized data management platform, has introduced Mesh ID, its latest Web3 solution aimed at revolutionizing access to tokenized Real-World Assets (RWAs) for over 22 million U.S. residents. This innovative tool is designed to simplify identity verification processes, enhance data privacy, and improve user accessibility to blockchain-based financial products in a way that aligns with regulatory requirements. Instruxi has collaborated with prominent industry players, including Chainlink, CLEAR, and Space and Time, to launch the Mesh ID solution as the initial module of its RWA platform. This collaboration, announced via a recent press release, leverages each partner’s strengths to optimize identity verification and provide robust data security for blockchain applications. Mesh ID integrates with CLEAR’s advanced API, enabling streamlined know-your-customer (KYC) processing without compromising user privacy or security. With CLEAR’s established track record of serving over 25 million users, Instruxi’s solution stands to benefit from a reputable, tier-one identity verification system. The Instruxi-CLEAR partnership facilitates faster pre-approval and minimizes KYC processing times, ultimately making on-chain financial products more accessible to U.S.-based users while ensuring regulatory compliance. In addition to CLEAR, Chainlink brings substantial value to Instruxi’s platform. As a leading decentralized computing platform, Chainlink supports Mesh ID’s seamless integration with enterprise systems, offering both on-chain and off-chain security assurances. Chainlink’s extensive suite of Oracle services has been pivotal in enabling secure data interactions, a key factor in asset tokenization’s projected $867 trillion market potential. Instruxi employs Chainlink Functions to enable access to real-world data via APIs and utilizes Chainlink Automation to ensure efficient, scalable operations within a decentralized framework. Further strengthening Mesh ID’s infrastructure, Instruxi has collaborated with Space and Time, a decentralized data warehouse for blockchain applications. Space and Time’s zero-knowledge database enables users to verify elements of their data and identity without exposing sensitive details on-chain. This feature enhances security while facilitating privacy-conscious access to RWAs, aligning with Instruxi’s mission to uphold data confidentiality as a cornerstone of its offerings. Austin Przybysz, Instruxi’s Co-Founder and Solutions Architect, highlighted the importance of the Mesh ID beta release, noting that this collaboration integrates KYC and identity verification within Instruxi Data Mesh to enable universal policy enforcement capabilities across the platform. He underscored the significance of combining high standards of user security with regulatory compliance to broaden accessibility to tokenized assets in a seamless, compliant manner. With the launch of Mesh ID, Instruxi is positioning itself at the forefront of asset tokenization, starting with tokenized real estate assets for its closed beta users. As the platform moves toward its full release, the company plans to expand its asset offerings to include additional classes, aligning with its goal to make a broad range of tokenized RWAs available through a user-centric, decentralized platform. Real-World Assets, or RWAs, refer to digital tokens that represent traditional financial assets, including cash, securities, commodities, and real estate, on the blockchain. By converting these assets into blockchain-based tokens, users gain new benefits such as fractional ownership, programmability, enhanced liquidity, transparency, and improved risk management. This emerging sector is gaining traction, with projections estimating a valuation of $10 trillion by 2030. Instruxi’s Mesh ID release signals a step toward a future where blockchain technology provides enhanced access to real-world financial assets in a way that preserves data privacy, streamlines verification processes, and ensures regulatory compliance. Through collaborations with industry leaders like Chainlink, CLEAR, and Space and Time, Instruxi demonstrates a commitment to creating an ecosystem where decentralized finance and real-world assets can coexist securely and efficiently. With Mesh ID’s launch, the platform takes a crucial step toward transforming how users interact with and access tokenized assets, setting a promising course for the future of Web3 applications in asset management. news_title: Safuu Unveils Safuu 2.0: A New Era in DeFi with Unprecedented Returns
news_content: Safuu, a prominent name in the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector, has announced the launch of Safuu 2.0, a transformative update to its original protocol. Building on the success of Safuu 1.0, the new version promises enhanced features and unparalleled earning opportunities, aiming to set new standards in the DeFi ecosystem. Safuu 1.0 had earned a notable reputation for delivering consistent and substantial returns, gaining widespread trust and adoption within the DeFi community. With Safuu 2.0, the platform aspires to elevate this success, offering a more robust and sustainable model to maximize user earnings. At the core of Safuu 2.0 is the innovative Stake-To-Earn model, which allows users to earn up to an astonishing 102,800% annual percentage yield (APY). This model enables users to stake their tokens in various staking pools and receive automated compound interest every fifteen minutes, totaling 96 payouts daily. This frequent payout structure ensures users can maximize their returns with minimal effort, making it an attractive option for both novice and experienced investors. Safuu 2.0 offers a unique APY of up to 102,800%, the highest in the industry. This fixed and guaranteed APY is backed by the protocol, providing users with confidence as they stake their tokens. A cornerstone of the Safuu 2.0 protocol is the Safuu High-Yielding External Revenue Income Fund Forever (SHERIFF) model. This model utilizes Flash Loan revenue on the BASE Blockchain to generate additional income, providing a bonus on top of the fixed APY for all stakers. Safuu 2.0 introduces a novel concept within DeFi called Statically Charged Rebasing. This sustainable interest model issues tokens at a protocol level with a static supply, eliminating token dilution and ensuring long-term sustainability. Through the SHERIFF model, Safuu 2.0 drives targeted revenue to the protocol, achieving long-term growth and sustainability. This automated eligibility feature allows all stakers to benefit from consistent revenue generation. Safuu 2.0 offers a range of staking pools to cater to different investment preferences, each with a fixed APY and the added SHERIFF bonus: 12-month stake: 102,800% APY + SHERIFF Bonus9-month stake: 57,825% APY + SHERIFF Bonus6-month stake: 38,550% APY + SHERIFF Bonus3-month stake: 19,275% APY + SHERIFF Bonus30-day stake: 4,224% APY + SHERIFF Bonus14-day stake: 1,971% APY + SHERIFF Bonus7-day stake: 985% APY + SHERIFF Bonus1-day stake: 140% APY + SHERIFF BonusThese fixed APYs ensure that users can choose a staking duration that best fits their investment strategy while enjoying guaranteed returns. Bryan Legend, a leading figure in the DeFi sector, has expressed significant enthusiasm about the launch of Safuu 2.0. He highlighted that the new version represents a rebirth of the well-established Safuu brand and will usher in a new wave of earning potential in 2024 and beyond. This statement underscores the anticipation and optimism surrounding Safuu 2.0’s impact on the DeFi landscape. Safuu 2.0 represents a significant advancement in the DeFi space, building on the foundation laid by its predecessor. With its innovative Stake-To-Earn model, unprecedented APY, and the SHERIFF revenue model, Safuu 2.0 aims to provide users with an enhanced and sustainable earning opportunity. As the platform continues to evolve, it is set to play a pivotal role in the DeFi ecosystem, offering investors a robust and reliable means to maximize their returns. news_title: Ethereum Wallets Surge in Popularity as Plus Wallet Redefines User Experience
news_content: Ethereum has been witnessing unprecedented growth, with wallets now collectively holding over 19 million ETH. Projections suggest this number could exceed 20 million by year’s end, marking a significant milestone that reflects a rising interest in cryptocurrency among prominent economic players. This surge in Ethereum holdings underscores the increasing role of digital assets in mainstream financial markets and has drawn attention to the critical role of secure, feature-rich wallets. Throughout 2024, Ethereum wallet usage has experienced substantial growth, with the total amount of ETH held rising from 11.5 million at the beginning of the year to over 19 million by mid-October. Valued at approximately $2,700 per ETH, these holdings are currently worth close to $80 billion, a figure comparable to the market capitalizations of some leading global corporations. Industry observers attribute part of this growth to the recent approval of Ethereum spot ETFs, which has boosted investor confidence and helped cement Ethereum’s place as a key financial asset. As the value and prevalence of digital assets grow, so does the demand for wallets that provide more than just storage. Emerging platforms like Plus Wallet are responding by offering a suite of functionalities designed to enhance user engagement and satisfaction. In addition to multi-chain accessibility, Plus Wallet provides robust security features and dual rewards programs, making it a popular choice for those navigating the expanding cryptocurrency landscape. Amid the increased focus on Ethereum, another notable development comes from Ctrl Wallet, which is enhancing its operational framework by migrating its $XDEFI token to $CTRL. This transition aims to improve token liquidity and optimize the wallet’s token structure for a more seamless user experience. Holders of $XDEFI and $vXDEFI on Ethereum and Arbitrum are encouraged to exchange their tokens for $CTRL at a one-to-one ratio through a dedicated migration portal, with fees waived until the end of 2024. Leading exchanges, including KuCoin and Huobi, are supporting this transition, and 32% of the total $CTRL token supply will be secured in liquidity pools for the next twelve months. This move toward a deflationary token model reflects a strategic approach to preserving the token’s value over time, highlighting Ctrl Wallet’s commitment to robust, long-term token economics. The rapid expansion of the cryptocurrency market, especially within the Web3 sector, has fueled demand for versatile wallets that offer flexibility and adaptability to cater to emerging opportunities. Traditional wallets often limit users to a single network, restricting their trading and exploration capabilities. However, Plus Wallet has set itself apart by addressing these limitations with a cross-chain functionality, enabling users to manage and trade assets across various blockchain networks from one interface. This feature not only simplifies the trading process but also enables users to engage with a broader range of assets and access new projects at early stages. In addition to cross-chain access, Plus Wallet incorporates unique rewards features aimed at boosting user satisfaction. The platform’s “Swap to Earn” functionality rewards users with every trading transaction, providing a straightforward means of increasing their earnings without requiring additional effort. Combined with stringent security measures like advanced encryption and two-factor authentication, Plus Wallet ensures that users can manage their assets securely while benefiting from consistent, user-driven rewards. The heightened interest in Ethereum among large-scale economic entities and mainstream stakeholders highlights the evolving role of cryptocurrencies in the financial landscape. This growing demand has catalyzed the development of more advanced wallet solutions that cater to the market’s diverse and sophisticated requirements. By equipping users with multi-functional wallets that prioritize security, flexibility, and financial empowerment, platforms like Plus Wallet are establishing themselves as essential tools for navigating the expanding Web3 environment. While Ctrl Wallet’s migration from $XDEFI to $CTRL demonstrates a strategic focus on liquidity and user experience, Plus Wallet is positioning itself as a comprehensive solution for cryptocurrency enthusiasts. With its multi-chain capabilities, robust security features, and user rewards, Plus Wallet aims to provide the level of control and flexibility required to capitalize on new opportunities in the Web3 space. The wallet’s blend of security and versatility makes it a leading choice for users seeking both functionality and protection in the fast-evolving cryptocurrency landscape. As the adoption of cryptocurrencies and Ethereum wallets grows, the need for user-centric platforms becomes more apparent. By addressing security concerns, enhancing trading accessibility, and fostering user engagement, wallets like Plus Wallet are helping to shape the future of digital asset management, offering users the tools to navigate the rapidly evolving financial landscape with confidence. news_title: Morph Launches on Ethereum, Targeting Mass Blockchain Adoption
news_content: Morph, a globally recognized platform for advancing blockchain adoption, has officially launched its mainnet on Ethereum, a significant development in its journey toward creating a blockchain experience that is accessible to mainstream users. The launch of the Morph mainnet introduces a consumer layer designed to overcome common adoption barriers by enabling participants to trade real assets and engage in various blockchain transactions. With the mainnet now live, projects already developed on Morph can seamlessly transition to this broader ecosystem, potentially increasing user engagement and accelerating the platform’s consumer-focused growth. CEO and co-founder Cecilia Hsueh emphasized that this mainnet launch is a major achievement in Morph’s goal to bring blockchain technology to a broad audience. She indicated that most decentralized applications (DApps) are currently inaccessible to everyday users and stated that Morph’s objective is to bridge this gap by providing a decentralized, scalable, and secure infrastructure. This will enable developers to create the next generation of user-friendly DApps and offer non-crypto natives the opportunity to interact easily within the blockchain ecosystem. Morph’s consumer layer is a comprehensive environment combining advanced blockchain technologies, such as optimistic and zero-knowledge (ZK) rollups, which improve both security and scalability. The solution is crafted to address longstanding issues in blockchain, including regulatory restrictions, scalability limitations, and performance challenges. With these improvements, Morph is striving to make blockchain accessible to a wider user base by offering builders an experience that prioritizes scalability, security, and simplicity. Morph’s mainnet debut builds on the successes of its earlier Holesky testnet, which featured several key upgrades that have been integrated into the mainnet. One notable advancement was the EIP-4844 Optimistic zkVM integration, a feature that reduces transaction costs and offers an updated bridge mechanism allowing for single-transaction withdrawals. During the testnet phase, Morph recorded substantial engagement, with over six million wallet addresses, more than 100 million transactions, 200 projects deployed, and over one million community members. This high level of activity highlights the network’s appeal to developers and users alike and lays a strong foundation for further adoption on the mainnet. COO and co-founder Azeem Khan highlighted that Morph’s goal is to be a comprehensive resource for global builders, providing them with tools to help them achieve success in launching and scaling their blockchain projects. He pointed out that while decentralization is critical, builders face challenges in finding the resources needed for successful project development, launch, and expansion. Morph aims to address this gap by creating an environment tailored to the needs of builders, thereby facilitating a more accessible path to blockchain success. Morph distinguishes itself from other blockchain platforms by prioritizing a consumer-focused approach rather than remaining limited to purely technical features. This consumer layer strategy involves offering critical resources to builders, including funding, incubation, acceleration, and market strategies, all aimed at fostering a user-first approach to blockchain development. Among its initiatives, Morph recently launched the Centralized Exchange Coalition, which includes several leading centralized exchanges, to empower builders with the tools necessary to bring projects to market, attract new users, and secure essential funding. Through these supportive measures, Morph seeks to position itself as a significant driver of blockchain innovation and adoption, facilitating a new wave of user-friendly applications that can appeal to a broad audience. This support system aligns with Morph’s overarching vision of transforming the blockchain industry from a niche technological space to an accessible mainstream utility. By equipping builders with the necessary resources, Morph aims to generate a broad ecosystem of applications that meet diverse user needs and contribute to increased blockchain adoption. Morph operates as a global consumer layer, serving as a distribution hub that provides builders with the resources needed to launch and scale their projects for the mass market. Through the use of hybrid rollup technology, combining ZK and Optimistic rollups, and employing a decentralized sequencer, Morph opens up limitless possibilities for developers targeting a mainstream audience. This unique blend of technology allows Morph to offer a user-friendly experience for developers who seek to create accessible and secure blockchain applications. As one of Morph’s original investors, Bitget, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, will continue to play a role in supporting the Morph ecosystem and contributing to its growth. With these strategic partnerships and innovative technologies, Morph is positioned to make a significant impact on the blockchain industry by paving the way for consumer-friendly, scalable applications that cater to everyday users. By emphasizing accessibility, resource support, and advanced technology, Morph aims to transform the blockchain landscape and drive a new era of blockchain adoption for all. news_title: US States Approach Cardano for Developing Blockchain Voting System
news_content: In a recent interview with Frederik Gregaard, CEO of the Cardano Foundation, it was revealed that several US states have approached the Foundation with the intention of developing a blockchain-based voting system. Gregaard highlighted the growing interest among government bodies in leveraging blockchain technology to enhance electoral processes. The states’ objective revolves around creating a lightweight blockchain solution aimed at enhancing transparency and accountability in voting systems. Gregaard disclosed that the Foundation Cardano received inquiries from US states seeking assistance in developing a blockchain solution to improve the transparency and accountability of their voting processes. He emphasized the need to analyze whether such a solution could be developed within the timeframe specified by the states. Despite the enthusiasm surrounding blockchain technology’s potential in voting systems, Gregaard also expressed concerns regarding the challenges involved, particularly meeting the states’ implementation deadlines.  US States 🇺🇸 have approached the Cardano Foundation for help with voting on the blockchain.@F_Gregaard@Cardano_CF@AltcoinDailyio#Cardano$ADAhttps://t.co/yQizvBqOM0pic.twitter.com/87OTP15MFT — St₳kΣ with Pride 🌈 (@StakeWithPride)March 28, 2024  Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano (ADA), recently addressed pressing issues related to the blockchain project in response to inquiries from the community. Selected questions from Cardano users prompted Hoskinson to provide clarifications on various aspects of the project. In a shared video, Hoskinson addressed the notion that Cardano’s success hinges on the presence of a well-recognized stablecoin within its ecosystem. While acknowledging the importance of implementing stablecoins with robust support, he affirmed that the Cardano Foundation is actively pursuing this objective. news_title: CoinTrust.com – About Us - CoinTrust
news_content: There’s so much buzz about currencies but to be honest there are not many sites that tell the whole story, the true story, about what’s hot and what’s not in the world of digital currencies. As an investor what you are sure to be looking for is information on the best currencies in the market that would give you more bang for your bucks. Some investors aren’t too sure about the whole idea of these relatively new digital currencies while some are looking for the best crypto-currency exchanges or the top crypto-currency wallets where they can buy, sell and potentially store and profit from their precious bitcoins or altcoins without any hassles. Call us a team of geeks, experts or veterans in crypto if you wish, there will always be another term that will reflect our passion for the digital currency. Yes, we are early crypto adopters. We have a finger on the pulse of all things crypto and wish to share it through unbiased reviews of every single crypto currency, wallets, and exchanges that exist. Our goal is to help readers find out if a currency is trustworthy or a scam and then purchase coins from the right sources. We can help navigate those complex decisions by making the process less tedious. Without doubt, every member of our team is a technology lover with a passion to decode interesting stuff about crypto currencies into simple words for the masses. So if you really want to know your crypto we are the right site for you. We provide: With cointrust.com users can remain updated about the latest price movements, the volume of trading, the latest trends in local and global markets, and a lot more. Our guides will not only educate new users on crypto currencies but also give them a peek into the world of crypto currency mining and how hashing works. You won’t find any secret sauce to getting rich quick but you will find plenty of ammo to become a smart crypto currency trader. Everything we highlight, discuss or present is after we’ve done all the homework so you won’t be alone in the journey. We believe what we learn along the way will be of great help to investors looking for some new avenues to potentially take home a profit. Every exchange is different and has its own strengths and weaknesses. In addition, an exchange may appeal to one and not the other. For example, if you want to only buy bitcoins with the objective of transferring them to your own storage then your needs are different from those who plan to trade their bitcoins against fiat or other currencies to make a profit. Stick around with cointrust.com and you will learn how to select a reputed exchange with a good track record. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions, comments or suggestions. Remember, it’s all about investing smartly.Never put more in crypto-currencies than you can afford to lose.
